p: Flavors and fragrances are complicated chemical mixtures of volatile organic molecules with different physicochemical properties (e.g., volatility, water solubility) [ 71]. High consumer demand for the improved flavor of industrial food products led to encapsulation of flavor and aroma compounds. The primary objectives of encapsulation of flavors are to capture and retain the integrity of their complicated composition during the processing and prolonged storage. Flavors can be incorporated into mixtures using a wide variety of carriers. Encapsulated flavors are better protected against external oxidation yielding their greater stability. They also provide a dry version of what are usually liquid flavors, thus they can easily be worked into dry products [ 83].
